attributes.action: Instruct Wakefield District Council to abandon its parking charges at Pugneys Country Park
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Pugneys Country Park is owned by Wakefield Council. It is a 300 acre park which is used regularly by the residents of Wakefield and its surrounding areas for exercise, dog walking, sports training and plain simple enjoyment. Wakefield District Council have ruled that as of 1st April 2008 that a £2 parking fee will be charged to all who park their vehicles. For the people who use this park regularly it will mean they will need to pay upto £14 per week to walk along the parks paths. Hundreds of people use this park daily and its is unacceptable to ask people to pay to park to use a public park which is already funded through council tax charges.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "Instruct Wakefield District Council to abandon its parking charges at Pugneys Country Park."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.number10.gov.uk/Page16555


Prime Minister's Office
